description: From Middle French chiromancie, from Latin chīromantīa, from Ancient Greek χειρομαντεία (kheiromanteía), from χειρο- (kheiro-, “hand-”) + μαντεία (manteía, “divination, fortune-telling”). Equivalent to chiro- +‎ -mancy.

entries.meaning: Synonym of palmistry: fortune-telling performed by reading another's hand.
examples: If they fore-tell things that shall happen by signes that they see in lines of a mans hand; then it is called Chyromancie...
